definitions.definition: a feeling of extreme worry, sadness, or pain:
examples: She claimed that the way she had been treated at work had caused her extreme emotional and psychological distress.

definitions.definition: a situation in which you are suffering or are in great danger and therefore in urgent need of help:
examples: Six people were rescued by helicopter from a fishing boat in distress off the coast.

definitions.definition: to make someone feel very upset or worried:
examples: I hope I haven't distressed you with all these personal questions.
